alert.note: Alert for Southern Inner Channels (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 10 at 4:18AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following area, Southern Inner Channels. This includes the cities of Ketchikan And Metlakatla. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain is falling across the area with over 2.5 inches since it changed from snow to rain Saturday night. This rain has already caused the snow depth to decrease from 25 inches down to 16 inches as of 3pm Sunday near Ketchikan. Additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches through Monday afternoon on a deep primed snowpack will continue the rapid snowmelt, increased runoff, and possible ponding of water and localized flooding. Flows in rivers may also increase quickly and reach critical levels.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
